name: 1,3-propanedithiol
Reason: 1,3-propanedithiol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is ethanol, which has a melting point of -114.1 degrees Celsius. The introduction of two additional phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. Each phenyl group may contribute around +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. Additionally, the sulfur atom introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, which may contribute around +10.
